poker

Class GameOfPoker

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • poker.GameOfPoker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GameOfPoker
extends java.lang.Thread
    A game of poker which extends the Thread class. Supports one HumanPokerPlayer player and up to four additional AutomatedPokerPlayer players. Uses a TwitterStream for input and output.
    Author:
    Dara Callinan, Jazheel Luna, Eoghan O'Donnell, Crischelle Pana

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameOfPoker

        public GameOfPoker(java.lang.String threadName,
                   TwitterStream tw,
                   int playerAmount)
            throws twitter4j.TwitterException,
                   java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Class constructor. Initialises the player list by generating several AutomatedPokerPlayer objects in addition to one HumanPokerPlayer object.
        Parameters:
        threadName - The Thread name for this object.
        tw - The TwitterStream to be used for input and output.
        playerAmount - The amount of players in the game, limited to the range 2-5 incl.
        Throws:
        twitter4j.TwitterException - If a Twitter API request is denied.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the AI names text file cannot be read.

    • Method Detail

      • getThread

        public void start()
        Overrides:
        start in class java.lang.Thread

      • getRandomAIPlayer

        private AutomatedPokerPlayer getRandomAIPlayer()
                                        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Creates a new AutomatedPokerPlayer with a random name read from a text file. Names that have already been used for PokerPlayer objects in the players list are not used.
        Returns:
        A new AutomatedPokerPlayer with a random name from a text file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the AI name-containing file cannot be read.

      • getHumanPlayer

        public HumanPokerPlayer getHumanPlayer()
        Returns the HumanPokerPlayer in this game.
        Returns:
        The HumanPokerPlayer

      • removeBankruptPlayers

        private void removeBankruptPlayers()
        Removes all PokerPlayer objects in the players list who are bankrupt.

      • getWinner

        private PokerPlayer getWinner()
        Returns a winning PokerPlayer if there is one PokerPlayer left in the players list, otherwise returns null.
        Returns:
        The winning PokerPlayer or null if one does not exist.

      • startGame

        private void startGame()
        Completes an entire game of poker. Multiple RoundOfPoker objects are created and run to completion. The method terminates when a winner can be determined, the human player has left, or the human player is bankrupt.
        See Also:
        RoundOfPoker
